emails.subject: Re: DCS-1212 RE: Sugar dasboard
emails.body_text:
It was created for a potential client ( Coca Cola ) who never signed.  I think it can be removed from the sugar part of the dashboard now


________________________________

From: Enea Albertoli <jira@dnext.atlassian.net>
Sent: 16 April 2025 14:41
To: John Stansfield <john.stansfield@dnext.io>
Subject: DCS-1212 RE: Sugar dasboard 
 
—-—-—-— 
Reply above this line. 

Enea Albertoli commented:

Hello John,

Firas a few months ago made a dashboard for the sugar team and used one of the datasets created by Afef for the occasion. He had, therefore, added it to the Sugar Supply in Demand, I figure because he thought it would be useful for sugar analysis.

We currently have a dashboard for this product, biogasoline, and multiple other products on stage <https://stage.dnext.io/dashboard/*/Energy/EU/f936991b-fec7-46ed-973d-fede5955e784>  and it is awaiting final approval to move forward to Dnexr. It will be a major upgrade not only for the availability of multiple products but also for the integration of national datasets along with Eurostat.

Best,

Enea

Enea Albertoli commented:

Hello John,

Firas a few months ago made a dashboard for the sugar team and used one of the datasets created by Afef for the occasion. He had, therefore, added it to the Sugar Supply in Demand, I figure because he thought it would be useful for sugar analysis.

We currently have a dashboard for this product, biogasoline, and multiple other products on stage and it is awaiting final approval to move forward to Dnexr. It will be a major upgrade not only for the availability of multiple products but also for the integration of national datasets along with Eurostat.
